title: Janet Yellen
added: On June 27, 2017, Yellen stated that she did not expect another financial crisis "in our lifetime". Yellen explained that this assumption can be made due to her belief that banks are "very much stronger" as a result of Federal Reserve oversight.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2017/06/27/yellen-banks-very-much-stronger-another-financial-crisis-not-likely-in-our-lifetime.html|title=Yellen: Banks 'very much stronger'; another financial crisis not likely 'in our lifetime'|last=Cox|first=Jeff|date=June 27, 2017|website=www.cnbc.com|access-date=March 7, 2019|archive-date=March 31, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190331204315/https://www.cnbc.com/2017/06/27/yellen-banks-very-much-stronger-another-financial-crisis-not-likely-in-our-lifetime.html|url-status=live}}</ref> On December 11, 2018 Yellen later warned of the possibility of a financial crisis by citing "gigantic holes in the system" after her departure from the Federal Reserve.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/yellen-warns-another-potential-financial-crisis-gigantic-holes-system-n946391|title=Former Fed head Janet Yellen warns of potential financial crisis ahead|website=NBC News|language=en|access-date=March 7, 2019|archive-date=March 7, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190307173820/https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/yellen-warns-another-potential-financial-crisis-gigantic-holes-system-n946391|url-status=live}}</ref>

title: Janet Yellen
added: ''Who's Yellen Now?'' is a song by [[Dessa]], commissioned by [[Marketplace_(radio_program)|Marketplace]]<ref name="ScaryMommy (and Yahoo!News) Julie Scagell: Biden Wanted A ‘Hamilton’-Style Song About Janet Yellen — And He Got It">{{cite web | url=https://www.scarymommy.com/janet-yellen-hamilton-song-dessa/ | title=Biden Wanted A ‘Hamilton’-Style Song About Janet Yellen — And He Got It | publisher=Scarymommy.com | work=Web Post | date=23 January 2021 | accessdate=25 January 2021 | author=Scagell,Julie}}</ref> following the suggestion by then President-elect [[Joe_Biden|Joe Biden]] for a [[Hamilton_(musical)|Hamiltonesque]] play about Yellen as the first woman [[United_States_Secretary_of_the_Treasury|secretary of the treasury]] on December 1, 2020.<ref name="Biden picks Yellen as first female Treasury Secretary">{{cite news | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XjXMkR3BwgI&feature=emb_logo&t=1120 | title=WATCH: President-elect Joe Biden formally introduces his economic team | work=President-elect's Press Briefing | date=1 December 2020 | agency=PBS Newshour | accessdate=24 January 2021 | location=Wilmington, Delaware}}</ref><ref name="twincities.com Doomtree rapper Dessa pens ode to Janet Yellen">{{cite web | url=https://www.twincities.com/2021/01/22/dessa-janet-yellen-song-whos-now-rap/ | title=Taking a cue from Biden, Doomtree rapper Dessa pens ode to Janet Yellen | publisher=St. Paul Pioneer Press | work=Article | date=22 January 2021 | accessdate=25 January 2021 | author=RAIHALA, ROSS}}</ref>

With vocals and lyrics by Dessa and production by [[Lazerbeak]] and Andy Thompson ''Who's Yellen Now?'' was first released on the [https://www.marketplace.org/2021/01/21/yellen-hamilton-musical-biden-dessa/ January 21, 2021, episode of Marketplace].<ref name="Marketplace: Dessa Interview">{{cite web | url=https://www.marketplace.org/2021/01/21/yellen-hamilton-musical-biden-dessa/ | title=Biden: Yellen needs a “Hamilton” musical. Dessa: Here you go. | publisher=Marketplace.org | work=Radio Interview | date=21 January 2021 | accessdate=25 January 2021 | author=Staff, Marketplace}}</ref> The 8:21 segment includes a [[Kai_Ryssdal|Kai Ryssdal]] interview with Dessa in which she states "it was really exciting to become a fan of Janet Yellen."<ref name="Marketplace interview with Dessa">{{cite interview | title=Biden: Yellen needs a “Hamilton” musical. Dessa: Here you go. | date=21 January 2021 | accessdate=24 January 2021 | last=Wander | first=[[Dessa]] | interviewer=Kai Ryssdal | program=Marketplace}}</ref> The [https://www.marketplace.org/2021/01/21/yellen-hamilton-musical-biden-dessa/ webpage for the segment] also includes the complete lyrics of the song. The first verse of which concludes:
It only took a couple centuries
The first female secretary of the treasury

title: Janet Yellen
added: [[Category:Women members of the Cabinet of the United States]]

title: Janet Yellen
deleted: According to her financial disclosures, Janet Yellen received 800 000 $ as speaking fees from Citadel LLC.

Citadel LLC a Citago-based hedge fund which has been criticised during the GME Short Squeeze of 2021 for its financial ties to Melvin Capital, to which it loaned 3 bn $ to shore up its finances, and its financial ties to the trading app Robinhood, who according to a Washington Post article, "makes a large amount of revenue from Citadel Securities" and "“market makers” fees to access real-time information about which stocks its users are buying and selling, a practice some regulators and industry watchers have seen as a potential conflict of interest".

The backing of Melvin Capital by Citadel LLC occured 2 days before the trading app Robinhood blocked and restricted the trading of GME shares, prompting many across the political spectrum to ask for investigations into possible financial malpractice.
This means that as Treasure Secretary, Yellen may have to investigate a firm from whom she received hundreds of thousands of dollars in speaking fees.

title: Janet Yellen
deleted: During 2019, Yellen accepted $810,000 to give speeches to [[Citadel LLC]]. <ref>https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2021/01/janet-yellen-paid-speeches-citadel-gamestop.html</ref>
